text: these were the scenes at the check-in
desks at Charles de Gaulle Airport as a
news emerge this morning the EgyptAir
flight took off from here hours earlier
at 9 minutes past 11:00 yesterday
evening
the airline said there were 56
passengers including one child and two
babies as well as 10 crew on board
flight ms 804 the airbus a320 was
travelling from palace to cairo it
disappeared from radar about 10 miles
after answering Egyptian airspace above
the Mediterranean Sea the airline
tweeted that flight M s 804 lost contact
at quarter to 3:00 this morning about 20
minutes before it was scheduled to land
in the Egyptian capital and they said
they'd contacted the authorities the
majority of the passengers were from
Egypt there was one British citizen and
15 were French Republica two knew the
President of the Republic had held an
urgent meeting with the Prime Minister
and other ministers the first priority
is to inform the families the foreign
ministry Crisis cell is operational an
emergency number has been provided and
the families have been hosted at a hotel
at Rossi search teams have been sent to
the last recorded location 30 to 40
miles north of Egypt's coast according
to one unconfirmed report the captain of
a ship which was about 150 miles south
of the Greek island of carpetas reported
seeing a flame in the sky well they've
now pinpointed roughly where they think
it's gone down unfortunate is the
deepest part of the Mediterranean now my
understanding is that they are ships and
there's boats and there's also a radar a
white plane on its way to the crash site
and so they are basically suggesting
that it has actually gone down into the
Mediterranean as time goes by Cairo
International Airport has become a focal
point where families of the missing
passengers have started to gather as
they await news of their loved ones
Cucina renton BBC news
